DataElement.preferredName: History of Peripheral Vascular Disease Present Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator for the presence an event in the personal medical history of peripheral vascular disease as evidenced by: 1. Claudication either with exertion or at rest; 2. Amputation for arterial vascular insufficiency; 3. Aorto-iliac occlusive disease reconstruction, peripheral vascular bypass surgery, angioplasty or stent; or percutaneous intervention to the extremities; 4. Documented abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) repair or stent; 5. Positive non-invasive/invasive test. It does not include procedures such as vein stripping, carotid disease, or procedures originating above the diaphragm. (from NIH Roadmap Cardiovascular Data Standards Working Group).

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have a histo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of symptomatic peripheral vascular disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have CTCAE Grade 2 or greater peripheral vascular disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have Grade 1, Category 2 or greater, peripheral vascular disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have grade II or greater peripheral vascular disease based on NCI CTC; e.g. ischemic rest pain, minor tissue loss, and ulceration or gangrene?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have clinically significant peripheral vascular disease or vascular disease (including aortic aneurysm or aortic dissection)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have clinically significant peripheral vascular disease or vascular disease (aortic aneurysm or aortic dissection)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient known to have peripheral vascular disease?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Chronic Disease Ind-3 (2018845v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1) - dbw
